text:
Line 147 of this class has a "FIXME" where the code for creating the root node
should be. A new install of Slide will not intialiase properly, throwing
something like the following thereafter:

creator: ricardo.gladwell@btinternet.com
ricardo.gladwell@btinternet.com
text:
I'm still getting this bug even with a new build of the latest from CVS.  For
some reason, Slide seems to be rolling back the creation of the root '/' URI.
Please see the mysql log attached to this bug. i have also attached the stdout
log for my slide installation and my domain.xml.

creator: ricardo.gladwell@btinternet.com
text:
Created attachment 12462
MySQL log for slide initialisation.

Created attachment 12463
Tomcat stdout log for Slide.
creator: ricardo.gladwell@btinternet.com

text:
Created attachment 12464
Domain.xml for my slide insatllation.
creator: ricardo.gladwell@btinternet.com

text:
what CVS version did you use.

I commited it to SLIDE_2_1_RELEASE_BRANCH. 
Now I have commited it to HEAD.

Sorry. could you retry again?
creator: luetzkendorf@apache.org

text: you have to update org.apache.slide.structure.StructureImpl too.
creator: luetzkendorf@apache.org
ricardo.gladwell@btinternet.com
text:
That seemed to fix the NPE, but I'm still getting the symptoms I was reporting
for the comment '2004-08-18 10:51' - Slide still seems to be rolling back the
SQL euries inserting the '/' node into the MySQL database. I cannot seem to
locate the line in the code where this is occuring.

creator: luetzkendorf@apache.org
text:
I now can reproduce your problem (:-) 
For a first step please try to set tm-commits to false in your domain.xml.

creator: luetzkendorf@apache.org
text: Ok, setting tm-commits to false is the way it is.
